  • Constructor Details

    • UserState

      public UserState()
      Create a new UserState with an empty collection of users and the currently logged-in user set to null. Then add pre-registered government representative accounts to the users list upon state creation. There is no functionality to register government representatives during runtime.

      Important note: DO NOT DO STORE SECRETS LIKE THIS IN A REAL APPLICATION. Why? Because anyone with the right tools can reverse engineer the code and see these login details in plain text. What to do instead? Load the appropriate details from environment variables or get them from an external server. Why did we not do this? It makes testing more difficult for you and security is not our main goal here - this will be the topic of next year's Computer Security course.

    • UserState

      public UserState​(IUserState other)
      Copy constructor to create a deep copy of another UserState instance
      Parameters:
      other - instance to copy
